intro: Scleria catharinensis, commonly known as the Brazilian sedge, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its upright, grass-like foliage and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Scleria catharinensis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
